# Core Rule 13 - Use realistic character names, and do not use names of famous people - No names of people or characters from the real world. Even if you switch a few letters around, be original. - No titles/honorifics (Exceptions being generational titles like - Must follow all other rules (no slurs/sexual names/etc) - Usernames, objects, random characters, very "low effort" names, "meta" names, or otherwise implausible names cannot be used as names. See examples below. - Admin rulings on IC names are final and disputes should be done through the forums, not by refusing to comply with an admin - Species have naming conventions that are part of their in-universe culture. These may be subverted if they have sufficient in-character reasoning and effort to explain their non-standard name. Non-standard names are held to higher scrutiny and you may be questioned on why your name breaks these conventions.
Naming Conventions:
Clowns and mimes are exempt from the prohibition on titles/honorifics and have loosened restrictions on low-effort and implausible names.
## Clarification on "Meta" Names Meta names are ones that attempt to take advantage of some game mechanic or game design choice. "Urist McHands" is a meta name because it is the default name used for admin-spawned humans. "Operator Whiskey" is a meta name because it follows the naming pattern of nuclear operatives. This rule is not intended to prevent things like nuclear operatives using a fake ID with names that appear to be nuclear operative names if they decide that they want to do that.
## Conventions and Examples [color=#994444]Bad[/color] cannot be used by any species. [color=#449944]Acceptable[/color] names can be used by any species.
Humans, Dwarves, Felinids, Vulpkanins, and Harpies should use the Firstname Lastname convention.
Examples - Tom Fisher - Spacey Chapman - Aaron Rikes
Reptilians should be using the Verb-article-Noun or an Argonian convention.
Examples - Cleans-the-Airlocks - Deekus - Deetum-Ja - Artemis - Rolls-the-Dice
Diona should have calm, nature-themed, Noun of Noun style names.
Examples
- Petal of Tranquility - Garden of Relaxation
Mothmen should have Latin-sounding names or light-themed names.
Examples - Socrates Temnora - Sierra Lightseeker - James Nightflitter
Arachnids should have Latin-sounding names.
Examples - Argyroneta Reticulatus - Loxosceles Domesticus
Vox use a single name made of random syllables, often with repeating patterns. Names should not be excessively long or be so repetitive/convoluted as to be unreadable.
Examples - Hirixashahre - Xapikrikrik - Chipikirchitchitchitbecretretrer
Rodentia naming convention goes "last first", the "last" part being a descriptor (Strong, Big-eyed, Trash-eating) and the "first" part either being a simple first name or pet name (Monty, Basil, Nibbles)
Examples - Big Poppy - Fast-paws Lily - Strong Peanut - Big-eyed Basil
Usernames, objects, random characters, very "low effort" names, "meta" names, or otherwise implausible names are not permitted.
